title: Authors and Citation
text: Neal Morton. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Morton N (2022). psifrr: Analysis visualization free recall data. R package version 0.1.0, https://mortonne.github.io/psifrr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {psifrr: Analysis and visualization of free recall data},   author = {Neal Morton},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://mortonne.github.io/psifrr/}, }

what: Analysis and visualization of free recall data
title: Analysis and visualization of free recall data
text: Analysis visualization free recall data. PsifrR currently relies Psifr Python package, called R using reticulate package.

title: Analysis and visualization of free recall data
text: First, install devtools reticulate: Follow reticulate package documentation set Python environment. Next, install Psifr Python package: Finally, install psifrr GitHub :

title: Analysis and visualization of free recall data
text: load sample dataset Psifr format: analyze dataset, need first score matching study items recalled items. See Scoring data details. can use filter_data select one list sample results look like: See Managing data full list functions operate free recall data.
code: library(psifrr) raw <- sample_data("Morton2013") head(raw) #>   subject list position trial_type       item item_number session list_type #> 1       1    1        1      study      TOWEL         743       1      pure #> 2       1    1        2      study      LADLE         631       1      pure #> 3       1    1        3      study    THERMOS         735       1      pure #> 4       1    1        4      study       LEGO         637       1      pure #> 5       1    1        5      study   BACKPACK         521       1      pure #> 6       1    1        6      study JACKHAMMER         621       1      pure #>   category response response_time list_category #> 1      obj        3         1.517           obj #> 2      obj        3         1.404           obj #> 3      obj        3         0.911           obj #> 4      obj        3         0.883           obj #> 5      obj        3         0.819           obj #> 6      obj        1         1.212           obj data <- merge_free_recall(raw) filter_data(data, subjects = 1, lists = 1) #>    subject list          item input output study recall repeat intrusion #> 0        1    1         TOWEL     1     13  TRUE   TRUE      0     FALSE #> 1        1    1         LADLE     2    NaN  TRUE  FALSE      0     FALSE #> 2        1    1       THERMOS     3    NaN  TRUE  FALSE      0     FALSE #> 3        1    1          LEGO     4     18  TRUE   TRUE      0     FALSE #> 4        1    1      BACKPACK     5     10  TRUE   TRUE      0     FALSE #> 5        1    1    JACKHAMMER     6      7  TRUE   TRUE      0     FALSE #> 6        1    1       LANTERN     7    NaN  TRUE  FALSE      0     FALSE #> 7        1    1      DOORKNOB     8     11  TRUE   TRUE      0     FALSE #> 8        1    1        SHOVEL     9      9  TRUE   TRUE      0     FALSE #> 9        1    1        SHOVEL     9     19 FALSE   TRUE      1     FALSE #> 10       1    1     WATER GUN    10    NaN  TRUE  FALSE      0     FALSE #> 11       1    1 INK CARTRIDGE    11    NaN  TRUE  FALSE      0     FALSE #> 12       1    1         PHONE    12     16  TRUE   TRUE      0     FALSE #> 13       1    1    PAPER CLIP    13     17  TRUE   TRUE      0 24      1  TRUE   TRUE      0     FALSE #> 25       1    1         CHAIN    24     14 FALSE   TRUE      1     FALSE #>    prior_list prior_input #> 0         NaN         NaN #> 1         NaN         NaN #> 2         NaN         NaN #> 3         NaN         NaN #> 4         NaN         NaN #> 5         NaN         NaN #> 6         NaN         NaN #> 7         NaN         NaN #> 8         NaN what: Check raw free recall data — check_data
title: Check raw free recall data — check_data
text: Run checks raw (unmerged) free recall data.

title: Check raw free recall data — check_data
Check raw free recall data — check_data
text: data Raw free recall data standard format.

title: Check raw free recall data — check_data
code: # Create data with a required column missing raw <- data.frame(   subject = list(1, 1),   list = list(1, 1),   position = list(1, 2),   item = list("a", "b") )  # Checking this dataset will display an error # check_data(raw)

title: Filter free recall data — filter_data
text: Filter raw scored data get subset trials study/recall pairings.

title: Filter free recall data — filter_data
code: filter_data(   data,   subjects = NULL,   lists = NULL,   trial_type = NULL,   positions = NULL,   inputs = NULL,   outputs = NULL )

title: Filter free recall data — filter_data
text: data Raw merged data filter. subjects Subject subjects include. lists List lists include. trial_type Trial type include. positions Position positions include. inputs Input position positions include. outputs Output position positions include.

title: Filter free recall data — filter_data
text: filtered subset data.

title: Filter free recall data — filter_data
code: # Filter data to get study events for subject 1 subjects_list <- list(1, 1, 2, 2) study_lists <- list(   list("a", "b"), list("c", "d"), list("e", "f"), list("g", "h") ) recall_lists <- list(list("b"), list("d", "c"), list("f", "e"), list()) raw <- table_from_lists(subjects_list, study_lists, recall_lists) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr' filter_data(raw, subjects = 1, trial_type = "study") #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'  # Filtered scored data to get subject 2 data <- merge_free_recall(raw) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr' filter_data(data, subjects = 2) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'

title: Score free recall data — merge_free_recall
text: Merge study recall events subject, list, item.

title: Score free recall data — merge_free_recall
code: merge_free_recall(   data,   merge_keys = NULL,   list_keys = NULL,   study_keys = NULL,   recall_keys = NULL,   position_key = "position" )

title: Score free recall data — merge_free_recall
text: data Free recall data Psifr format. Must subject, list, trial_type, position, item columns. merge_keys Columns use designate events merge. Default list(‘subject’, ‘list’, ‘item’), merge events related item, within list. list_keys Columns apply study recall events. study_keys Columns apply study events. recall_keys Columns apply recall events. position_key Column indicating position item either study list recall sequence.

title: Score free recall data — merge_free_recall
text: Merged information study recall events. row corresponds one unique input/output pair.

title: Score free recall data — merge_free_recall
code: raw <- sample_data("Morton2013") #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr' data <- merge_free_recall(raw) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'

what: Score study and recall events — merge_lists
title: Score study and recall events — merge_lists
text: Merge separated study recall events subject, list, item.

title: Score study and recall events — merge_lists
code: merge_lists(   study,   recall,   merge_keys = NULL,   list_keys = NULL,   study_keys = NULL,   recall_keys = NULL,   position_key = "position" )

title: Score study and recall events — merge_lists
text: study Information study events. one row study event. recall Information recall events. one row recall attempt. merge_keys Columns use designate events merge. Default list(‘subject’, ‘list’, ‘item’), merge events related item, within list. list_keys Columns apply study recall events. study_keys Columns apply study events. recall_keys Columns apply recall events. position_key Column indicating position item either study list recall sequence.

title: Score study and recall events — merge_lists
text: Merged information study recall events. row corresponds one unique input/output pair.

title: Score study and recall events — merge_lists
code: study <- data.frame(   subject = c(1, 1), list = c(1, 1), position = c(1, 2), item = c("a", "b") ) recall <- data.frame(subject = 1, list = 1, position = 1, item = "b") merge_lists(study, recall) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'

title: Reset list index — reset_list
text: Reset list numbering sequential starting one.

title: Reset list index — reset_list
Reset list index — reset_list
text: data Raw merged data. Must subject list fields.

title: Reset list index — reset_list
text: Data renumbered list field, starting 1.

title: Reset list index — reset_list
code: # Data where the list number does not start at 1 subjects_list <- list(1, 1) study_lists <- list(list("a", "b"), list("c", "d")) recall_lists <- list(list("b"), list("c", "d")) list_nos <- list(3, 4) raw <- table_from_lists(   subjects_list, study_lists, recall_lists,   lists = list_nos ) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr' raw #> function (length = 0L)  #> .Internal(vector("raw", length)) #> <bytecode: 0x55f1b76e02c0> #> <environment: namespace:base>  # Reset the list number reset_list(raw) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'

title: Load a sample dataset — sample_data
text: Load one included sample datasets.

title: Load a sample dataset — sample_data
Load a sample dataset — sample_data
text: study Study load (options: "Morton2013").

title: Load a sample dataset — sample_data
text: data.frame data specified study.

title: Load a sample dataset — sample_data
code: data <- sample_data("Morton2013") #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr' head(data) #>                                                                              #> 1 function (..., list = character(), package = NULL, lib.loc = NULL,         #> 2     verbose = getOption("verbose"), envir = .GlobalEnv, overwrite = TRUE)  #> 3 {                                                                          #> 4     fileExt <- function(x) {                                               #> 5         db <- grepl("\\\\.[^.]+\\\\.(gz|bz2|xz)$", x)                      #> 6         ans <- sub(".*\\\\.", "", x)

what: Convert data to split format. — split_lists
title: Convert data to split format. — split_lists
text: Convert study, recall, events list format.

title: Convert data to split format. — split_lists
code: split_lists(data, phase, keys = NULL, names = NULL, item_query = NULL)

title: Convert data to split format. — split_lists
text: data Free recall data raw merged format. phase Phase free recall ('study' 'recall') split. ‘raw’, trials included. keys Data columns include split data. specified, columns included. names Name column returned split data. Default use names input columns. item_query Query string select study trials include.

title: Convert data to split format. — split_lists
text: Data split format. included column key named list.

title: Convert data to split format. — split_lists
code: # Create raw and merged data list_subject <- list(1, 1) study <- list(list("absence", "hollow"), list("fountain", "piano")) recall <- list(list("absence"), list("piano", "fountain")) raw <- table_from_lists(list_subject, study, recall) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr' data <- merge_free_recall(raw) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'  # Get study events split by list, just including the list and item fields. split_lists(data, "study", keys = list("list", "item")) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'  # Export recall events, split by list. split_lists(data, "recall", keys = list("item")) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'  # Raw events (i.e., events that haven’t been scored) can also be exported to # list format. split_lists(raw, "raw", keys = list("position")) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'

what: Create table format data from list format data. — table_from_lists
title: Create table format data from list format data. — table_from_lists
text: Convert study recall lists table format.

title: Create table format data from list format data. — table_from_lists
Create table format data from list format data. — table_from_lists
text: subjects Subject identifier list. study List items study list. recall List recalled items study list. lists List list numbers. specified, lists subject numbered sequentially starting one. ... Additional arguments specify additional columns. must list first item indicates study list values second item indicates recall list values. either item NULL, column undefined phase.

title: Create table format data from list format data. — table_from_lists
text: Data table format.

title: Create table format data from list format data. — table_from_lists
code: # Create standard columns from list data. subjects_list <- list(1, 1, 2, 2) study_lists <- list(   list("a", "b"), list("c", "d"), list("e", "f"), list("g", "h") ) recall_lists <- list(list("b"), list("d", "c"), list("f", "e"), list()) table_from_lists(subjects_list, study_lists, recall_lists) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'  # Include non-standard columns named col1 and col2. subjects_list <- list(1, 1) study_lists <- list(list("a", "b"), list("c", "d")) recall_lists <- list(list("b"), list("d", "c")) col1 <- list(list(list(1, 2), list(1, 2)), list(list(2), list(2, 1))) col2 <- list(list(list(1, 1), list(2, 2)), NULL) table_from_lists(   subjects_list, study_lists, recall_lists,   col1 = col1, col2 = col2 ) #> Error in py_module_import(module, convert = convert): ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'psifr'
